title: Ion-conductive vs. non-ion-conductive ceramic fillers in silane-linked polyethylene oxide-based composite polymer electrolytes with high room-temperature ionic conductivity
content:
Energy Adv., 2024, Advance Article
DOI: 10.1039/D4YA00231H, Paper
Open Access
  This article is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported Licence.
Eun Ju Jeon, Sharif Haidar, Laura Helmers, Arno Kwade, Georg Garnweitner
Surface-modified ZrO2 fillers strongly facilitate Li+ transport in PEO-based electrolytes, but even simple addition of the modifier serves to greatly improve ionic conductivity, proving the crucial role of the additive–matrix interaction.
To cite this article before page numbers are assigned, use the DOI form of citation above.
